basic.floral_language:
Eustoma russellianum
Floriography: prudent, keen, sentimental
Eustoma russellianum is originated from the prairie in the southern United States to Mexico Flowers of Eustoma russellianum look like roses, but more light-hearted and elegant, with fresh color, becoming more and more popular among young people.
Eustoma russellianum is perennial, likes sunny days, each time it flowers for 2-3 weeks, after that, cut the main stem and the roots will sprout again, normally blossoms year after year.
basic.blooming: Flowering period April-August, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Long-day plant, likes sunshine, but avoid very strong sunlight
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, water daily in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely
